laboratory_examinations.findings: 95% calcium absorption from low-calcium feed; 85% from normal-calcium feed (normal for age: 45.6–62.5%)

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreasing calcium levels over subsequent tests: 16.3 mg/dL at admission to 10.2 mg/dL at 39 months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Undetectable levels in proband; mean in controls was 1.60 ng/mL.
Lower levels at 31 (52 pg/mL) and 39 months (20 pg/mL); normal range is 15–75 pg/mL.
Initial excretion at 16.1 mg/dL decreasing to 6.3 mg/dL at 39 months.
Range from 18 mg/dL to 21 mg/dL (normal range: 4–19 mg/dL).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial increase followed by a decrease at 31 months.
